original: Hägg, Carl Emil, lektor, Göteborg, f. 20/4/71 i Dingtuna, Västmianl. 1., av Gustaf H. o. Josefina Ohlenius. G. 11 m. Marie Louise Wittboldt. — Mog:-ex. i Västerås 91, fil. kand. i Upps. 93, fil. lic. i Gbg 11, fil. dr s. å. Föret, uppr. res. t. bl. a. Tyskl., Österr., Schweiz, Frankr., Belg., Ital., Jugoslav. o. Polen, delv. m. stip. Ensk. lär.-befattn. i Tyskl. 00-04, ord. lär. v. Gbgs hand :inst. 04, lektor i tyska där 19, lär. v. Gbgs gymn. f. fl. 05-11, v. h. lär:esem. i Gbg 08-14, lär. i tyska v. Gbgs hand :högsk. sed. 23. Led. av folksk :styr. o. styr. f. Gbgs h. folksk. 17-26. Skr.: Linköp -.handskriften av Cassiodorus’ Variæ (grad:avh.). Tysk handelskorresp.. Tyska skrivövn., Sv.-tyska affärstransaktioner i brev, Muntl. o. skriftl. övn :uppg. i tysk han-delskorresj:)., De sv. läroverkens förfall, Vad är sanning? RNO.
translated: Hägg, Carl Emil, lecturer, Gothenburg, born April 20th, 1871 in Dingtuna, Västmanland, son of Gustaf H. and Josefina Ohlenius. Married to Marie Louise Wittboldt in 1911. Completed his first exam in Västerås in 1891, bachelor degree at Uppsala in 1893, licensed to teach in Gothenburg in 1911, and achieved a PhD in the same year. Undertook travel to various countries including Germany, Austria, Switzerland, France, Belgium, Italy, Yugoslavia, and Poland with partial scholarships. Employed as a private teacher in Germany from 1900 to 1904, regular teacher at Gothenburg's commercial institute in 1904, lecturer in German there in 1919, teacher at Gothenburg Gymnasium from 1905 to 1911, vice headmaster for teacher training in Gothenburg from 1908 to 1914, and a German teacher at Gothenburg's business college since 1923. Member of the board of directors for public school and Gothenburg high school from 1917 to 1926. Writing includes the manuscript of Cassiodorus' Variæ (graduate thesis), German business correspondence, exercises in German writing, Swedish-German business transactions in letters, oral and written exercises in German business correspondence, and "The decline of Swedish secondary schools" and "What is truth?" Honorary member of Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences.
